result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

22CF576:  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. 

22CF653:  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Bond argument by DE.  Requesting SCRAM testing.  No objection by State or the victim.  Court will order SCRAM testing. All other conditions to remain.  

Court confirms address.  Adjourned:  8:56

8:46 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy     Defendant Curt Allan Hayden in court.  Attorney James S Robbins in court for Curt Allan Hayden.  Attorney Alec Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Robbins states DE wishes to waive the Preliminary hearing in this case and 22CF653 which is scheduled  11/9/22 w/ EFV.  State does not object.   

22CF576:  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.   

22CF653:  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. 

State indicates the Information in both cases will mirror the criminal complaint.  DE wishes to proceed with the Arraignment.

The original document was titled: Report
The original history event date is: 08-22-2022
Pretrial Assessment Report, reviewed during INIT. bph

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Justin F.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Defendant Curt Allan Hayden in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Bond argument; bond ordered. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets Preliminary Hearing. Adjourned at 1:37 PM.  gll
